nodes.bodyText: Don't you need to make sure to convert the quantity to the correct units before sending the command?

Done. I also added 1 decimal place formatting, which makes it consistent with the temp command in the CoolMasterNet Programmer Reference Guide.
Tested fine:
2020-05-15 09:26:02.433 [TRACE] [masternet.internal.ControllerHandler] - Waiting 25 ms for buffer to sink
2020-05-15 09:26:02.433 [TRACE] [masternet.internal.ControllerHandler] - Buffer empty following unsolicited > prompt
2020-05-15 09:26:02.433 [TRACE] [masternet.internal.ControllerHandler] - Sending command 'temp L4.000 23.0'
2020-05-15 09:26:02.434 [TRACE] [masternet.internal.ControllerHandler] - Read result 'OK'
......
2020-05-15 09:26:11.272 [TRACE] [masternet.internal.ControllerHandler] - Waiting 25 ms for buffer to sink
2020-05-15 09:26:11.298 [TRACE] [masternet.internal.ControllerHandler] - Buffer empty following solicited > prompt
2020-05-15 09:26:11.298 [TRACE] [masternet.internal.ControllerHandler] - Sending command 'query L4.000 t'
2020-05-15 09:26:11.299 [TRACE] [masternet.internal.ControllerHandler] - Read result '23'
2020-05-15 09:26:11.300 [TRACE] [masternet.internal.ControllerHandler] - Read result 'OK'
